title: I keep hearing about people who think they're superior because they buy Apple products, but I never ...

object.content:
I keep hearing about people who think they're superior because they buy Apple products, but I never encounter them.

I do frequently encounter people who think they're superior because they don't buy Apple products. They brag about how Apple users are brainwashed, but they (the unbrainwashed few) are superior enough to think for themselves.

These wonderful evolved self-thinkers all sound alike. You can hear them for yourselves in the comments on the article I've linked to here.

Apple users are no different than anyone else. We live in a consumer culture. You are part of it if you buy, no matter what you choose to buy. Don't think you're superior to the other guy because of what you choose to buy.

I'm part of consumer culture. I bought a new teapot just before leaving on this trip, and a new iPad while on the trip. They'll be waiting for me when I'm home and I'm looking forward to using both every day when I'm home.

I'm not saying it's wrong to hate Apple and its products. My friend +Ellis Booker won't touch them. He's a Linux and Android guy. And that's ok.

When my MacBook Pro finally dies (probably soon -- it's four years old) my next computer will likely be a Windows machine. I'm disappointed in that but it's not a big deal. And it might be fun to see what Windows has been up to in the last 7 years (I hear it's been up to no good, alas).

﻿
